meanings.definition: Plasmolyzed: (verb) to cause a cell to shrink due to loss of water
meanings.sent1: The salty solution plasmolyzed the plant cell, making it shrink.
meanings.sent2: The lack of rain plasmolyzed the leaves, causing them to wither.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty cell cried out, 'I've been plasmolyzed into a raisin!'
meanings.sent4: The heat wave plasmolyzed the once lush garden into a desert.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment vividly showed how cells can be plasmolyzed.

meanings.definition: Plasmolyzed: (adjective) describing a cell that has shrunk due to loss of water
meanings.sent1: The plasmolyzed cell looked wrinkled and sad under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The plasmolyzed leaves were a clear sign of dehydration in the plant.
meanings.sent3: The plasmolyzed cell joked, 'I'm feeling deflated today!'
meanings.sent4: The plasmolyzed flower petals resembled delicate paper in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The image of the plasmolyzed cell stuck in the students' minds after the biology lesson.
